attributes.action: Voting Results Transparency Through An Update of the Voting System
attributes.background: We call for an updated voting system, British people register once, when the time comes to vote they take a unique identifier with them to a local polling station where they can log onto an electronic terminal and submit their vote. The public should be able to view all the votes for transparency.
attributes.additional_details: Many will argue their anonymity will be breached through transparency, however this very anonymity has the potential to be used, to manipulate the general public to remain in a closed and unknown voting system, where the possibility of corruption of votes will remain. Transparency removes uncertainty and creates trust, a notion that perhaps will restore a small portion of much needed faith in our countries politics.

attributes.action: England to have a bank holiday every 1st Monday of every month.
attributes.background: We as a nation are overworked. We do not spend enough time enjoying the little things in life with the people that matter.

attributes.action: Present only balanced arguments to the public for country wide referendums
attributes.background: There are so many factors that go into something like the EU referendum and so many points of view, from infinitely many sources, that facts are lost/blurred in a "shouting match" between parties attempting to court our vote with ill or misinformed information.
attributes.additional_details: Using the EU referendum as an example again, we see too many "scare tactics" presented openly as "fact" by both leave and remain campaigners. This has led to many of us being left confused and feeling like we are backing the party with the loudest voice. I think one of two things would help everyone if another situation such as this should arise; either campaigns should always be presented with for AND against points equally or an independent analyst should present one document with all FACTS.

attributes.action: Increase winter fuel payments and make them taxable.
attributes.background: This is a universal benefit but is not paid to pensioners living in the EU. A precedent that this benefit is not universal but is paid on the basis of need. Thus it should be either taxed or means tested. It cannot be different rules for UK pensioners who choose to live in the EU.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for a vehicle Driver or Passenger  to Smoke with a Window Down !
attributes.background: Drivers & passengers that smoke with a window down hold their cigarettes outside of the vehicle with ash & smoke going into the eyes/faces of following motorcycles, bicycles etc. This can blind people in following vehicles causing accidents & fatalities. This should be made illegal on safety grounds
attributes.additional_details:
People have been blinded on several occasions by moving vehicles/cars/vans & stationary hgvs by ash blown into thier eyes. 
Drivers appear oblivious to the impact of their actions on other road users. For a driver this is also effectively 'not in control of the vehicle' driving with one hand. The main problem is the holding of a cigarette outside the vehicle where the forward motion or wind carries the ash into the eyes of other road users. The way to enforce would be to ensure no external smoke

attributes.action: All Police to be equipped with Naloxone kits to save lives
attributes.background:
Naloxone is a medication used to block the effects of opioids, especially in overdose.

I have provided a link to show how many Police Departments in America carry Naloxone and times it has saved lives. 

http://www.nchrc.org/law-enforcement/us-law-enforcement-who-carry-naloxone/

attributes.action: Ban Spithoods in all UK Institutions and Police Stations
attributes.background: After watching a news article about Spithoods being used on people in Pokice Custody, I was incensed at the thought of such barbaric items being used in 21st Britain. It upset me so much that i felt the need to start this petition to get them banned altogether. Just the thought of them made me ill
attributes.additional_details: These could cause a fatality in some cases especially where people suffer from claustraphobia it coukd cause asthma patients to struggle to breath and the list goes on

attributes.action: Lower the cost or remove the cost of PRS & PPL Licensing
attributes.background: Many people over the years has been paying mega amount for a piece of paper that will allow you to create an online radio station. The costs per year vary from £545 - £2000. Myself and others think it should be removed in general. Let young people run a station without the fear of getting a fine!

attributes.action: Reduce funding for the BBC by the production cost of the new Top Gear.
attributes.background: The new format of Top Gear does not show value for money for the UK TV Licence payer. The new format is focused on capturing the US market and the revenue it can receive. The BBC should then have the cost of the new format production reduced from it's annual funding.
attributes.additional_details: The new format of Top Gear does not show value for money for the UK TV Licence payer. The new format is focused on capturing the US market and the revenue it can receive. This is in effect is commercial TV and therefore should not have to be funded by the public purse. The BBC should then have the cost of the new format production reduced from it's annual funding until a UK audience based format is produced for the UK TV Licence payer.

attributes.action: Category D (bus) license holders to be upgraded to class 2 license for free.
attributes.background: Due to the similar size of vehicles and weight of vehicles category D (bus) show be allowed to drive class 2 vehicles.

attributes.action: Parliament to change the law, to require the votes of MPs to be published.
attributes.background:
To stop MPs verbally stating their intention to vote one way but voting another.
Also, to highlight "tactical" voting and to give clarity to the electorate.

attributes.action: Raise tuition fees please.
attributes.background: Tuition fees are far too low and students are getting off easy. Please raise them!
attributes.additional_details: Raise them.

attributes.action: Stop motor insurers voiding innocent drivers' insurance policies
attributes.background: After a non-fault road traffic accident where my spine was injured, I received notice that my insurance was to be voided due to inadvertent (or innocent) non-disclosure of material fact.  The insurer could have checked the details for free at any time, but waited til I claimed.
attributes.additional_details:
There are multiple cases where the insurer is voiding policies after a claim is made.  My argument is that they are collecting "Golden Tickets", where they let you pay a policy until they are liable for something, so removing all risk

- They have a responsibility to check the details when it is free to do so.
- They shouldn't void insurance for trivial date mix-ups on policy, but rewrite/update instead.
- After non-fault incidents insurers shouldn't be allowed to throw the claimant to the wall.

attributes.action: Amend the law on stamp duty on your main residence when you own a second home
attributes.background: If you cohabit and separate and want to transfer the main residence to your sole name you have to pay 3% stamp duty on your equity share coupled with your portion of any remaining mortgage when you own a second property.  This law does not apply if you are married so discriminates people cohabiting.
attributes.additional_details:
Stamp duty was paid when the house was originally purchased so how can you pay this again when you are not moving?
Why does the rule not apply if you were to sell the property?
Why does being married mean you are exempt?
The revenue state this is because you are increasing your share of property you own?
Surely the additional stamp duty should only be on the increase in market value/equity of the property over and above what you originally paid?

attributes.action: Make older homes comply with new building regs if proven harmful to occupants
attributes.background: In the past new homes were built to conserve energy, one way to this was to make them airtight. A side affect of this was insufficient ventilation, regulations have been changed in recent years to prevent this but older homes continue to harm their occupants with high levels of indoor pollution.
attributes.additional_details:
For 10 years I have owned a shared ownership leasehold apartment that suffers from insufficient ventilation, it has been proved to have very poor airflow but as it was given a completion certificate by the local authority I have been unable to persuade the Housing Association or the Freeholder to allow me to change the windows. 
For 6 years I was poisoned by excessive levels of CO2 that built up in my property while I was sleeping, 4 years ago I left my home and I am still waiting for resolve.

attributes.action: Include Microeconomics in the National Curriculum, beginning in Primary school
attributes.background:
Understanding why we make the decisions we do makes an individual a better decision-maker.
People make poor financial decisions every day, from payday loans to impulse purchases.
Educating the young to make them better decision-making adults is an highly worthwhile investment in the future.
attributes.additional_details:
Microeconomics is a branch of economics that studies the behavior of individuals and firms in making decisions regarding the allocation of limited resources.
It differs from macroeconomics, which is a branch of economics dealing with the performance, structure, behavior, and decision-making of an economy as a whole, rather than individual markets. 
With microeconomics, macroeconomics is one of the two most general fields in economics.

attributes.action: Mandatory first aid course free for parents
attributes.background: So as we all know trying to get to see a gp or get in to a walk in is a absolute nightmare. 2-4 hour wait each and every time. With quite recent events it got me thinking if every parent in the u.k underwent free mandatory first aid training for children it would free up so much time for the NHS.

attributes.action: Increase spending on front line policing and equip more officers with taser.
attributes.background: Although the police budgets have been protected, the front line policing has taken a massive hit. More money has been distributed to cyber crime etc. If we cannot invest in more officers then invest money in equipping current officers with taser as a safety measure.

attributes.action: Suspend tolls on the M6Toll when roadworks are in place on the M6
attributes.background: M6 roadworks bring traffic chaos to millions of drivers and businesses. More works are halving the capacity and reducing speed to 40mph for 6 months.  Relieve the stress to motorists and cost to business by suspending toll fees on M6Toll during roadworks affecting J11 to J4a.

attributes.action: Call for greater public scrutiny of how police forces are spending public money
attributes.background: Following the Hillsborough verdict, where 96 people died, greater scrutiny and reform is required to look at how public money is spent by the police to defend themselves and cover up their failure and mistakes. The Hillsborough victims’ families were denied the truth and struggled 27 yrs for justice
attributes.additional_details: The current system is unfair, unequal/bias against the victims and their families who deserve justice. Scrutiny and reform is required to monitor and stop those in the police and across our public services abusing public money to cover up their failures. The Hillsborough disaster proves how deep the covering up goes and how those in our public services do not admit their guilt but continue to pervert the course of justice. The government must act to hold those who abuse public funds accountable

attributes.action: Abolish the harsh new curriculum for secondary students!
attributes.background: The new secondary school curriculum is long, harsh and pointless. The amount of work and stress students put in does not equate to what students get out. The new tests take much more of students time and limits basic life skills such as team working.
attributes.additional_details: Lets bring back fairness to our education system, with your help we will!

attributes.action: Prevent tractors from using main roads during rush hour.
attributes.background: Rush hour is already a stressful part of the day, with the inclusion of tractors, causing long tail backs (and not pulling over), not being able to overtake because of the time of day this is making commutes longer and workers late.

attributes.action: Legislate that employers must publish how many professional roles are part time
attributes.background: The aim is to encourage large companies to offer more senior part time or job share work, to mirror the public sector where many such roles are available, e.g. teachers and doctors.  More transparency should help inclusion, and lead to a better gender balance at senior levels in the private sector.
attributes.additional_details:
For many women their career is over when they have a family as they want to return to their profession more flexibly but no jobs are available. The private sector needs to mirror the public sector where many opportunities are available. 
They will then be able to utilise the skills of women they have trained for much longer and this will lead to more women in senior roles.
This is timely with the new legislation regarding equal pay.
We understand that some senior roles can't be done part time.

attributes.action: Change Road tax back to engine size not emissions
attributes.background: The government changed Road tax to emissions based so those wealthy enough to afford new virtual emission free cars pay no Road tax but still 4 wheels wearing Road causeing potholes electric cars no Road tax paid

attributes.action: Stop volunteers doing mock interviews in schools, use paid Career Coaches
attributes.background:
action to promote consistent and proactive approach to career  coaching in schools /colleges. 
Each student to receive a career coaching programme to suit.
Mock interviews depends who is "interviewing". coaches should be paid for their skills and talents.
attributes.additional_details:
Coaching is not a career advisor  in another guise, most people have bad memories of advice in schools and the advice was useless for  most people.
Career Coaching is about the individual.

attributes.action: horses/horse drawn vehicles on UK roads regulated with certified riders/drivers
attributes.background: I am tired of seeing children on horses and horse drawn carriages on the roads riding with no knowledge of the highway code and no due care for legitimate road users, why can they travel uninsured or unregulated. only licenced users should be allowed to use the roads

attributes.action: Make social networks more responsible by verifying its users.
attributes.background: Social networks like Facebook don't allow anyone below the age of 18 to join their website. However, there is no verification process in place to enforce this. Profiles can be faked easily. Underage registration and exposure to all sorts of things - good and bad (mostly) is common.
attributes.additional_details:
This is resulting in all sorts of social problems that we are seeing every now and then - 

Getting influenced by terrorists
Getting bullied
etc

Age verification should be enforced legally to avoid fake profiles. Facebook, for example, can link to credit reference agencies to verify identity and age. Such information should be visible on friends and "friend requests".

Facebook penetrates our lives very intimately and is not a virtual world anymore that can stay unregulated.

attributes.action: Restructure Parliament to give UK citizens a 33% legal parliamentry vote.
attributes.background: The UK government no longer represents the opinions of it citizens whereby political parties are so entwined that voters no longer have a definitive choice. This petition seeks to address the needs of all UK citizens by providing an electronic voting platform to vote on parliamenty Bills.

attributes.action: Include peer-to-peer lending activities within the remit of the FSCS
attributes.background:
Peer-to-peer lending activities are not presently covered by the FSCS. The sector is regulated by the FCA however and many peer-to-peer lending platforms have set up internal reserve funds - further information may be found at http://innovativefinanceisa.org.uk/
The FSCS should be extended.

attributes.action: Change the spent conviction guideline for under 18s that turn 18 while on remand
attributes.background: People that are under 18 while on remand waiting for a plea date at court that turn 18 in the mean time are still convicted as an adult even though they was under 18 at the time of the offence commited help me change it so many more will have a chance of not reoffending and more likely to get a job.
attributes.additional_details: make the system more fare, give young offenders a fighting chance to turn their life's around when realised from prison. They wouldn't have to disclose there convictions for a ridiculous amount of time like adults do which isn't fare because they was under 18 at the time they commited the offence giving them much more of a chance obtaining a job or even a career. Why make it that much harder for them to turn their life's around. Do we Want kids still reoffending as adults?? Help break the cycle.

attributes.action: Call upon the government to provide a healthy food subsidy
attributes.background: Make the government responsible for health food subsidy to help combat obesity

attributes.action: Stop calling the rise in minimum wage the living wage as it clearly isn't.
attributes.background: The Tory party and now all the media have fallen in to a trap of calling the 50P rise in the minimum wage as the living wage. It is not the living wage and calling it such devalues the living wage.

attributes.action: Abolish The Houses of Parliament/Lords in favour of local Regional Assemblies.
attributes.background:
Staying in the European Community inevitably means more legislation being passed by the European Parliament that will supersede our sovereign legislation leaving our legislature as merely  nodding donkeys.
The money saved by closure of both houses is colossal with the saved money put to better use.

attributes.action: Stop Landlords from discriminating against individuals who claim housing benefit
attributes.background: As housing prices are rising, people are finding it harder to put put a roof over their heads. Many families facing financial difficulties are being turned away from renting simply because they claim housing benefit. As long as the landlord gets their money what is the problem?

attributes.action: Add a BH on the 1st/2nd Mon of Nov as a perpetual reminder celebrating WW1 & WW2
attributes.background: In 2018, it will be the 100th Anniversary of the end of WW1. We currently commemorate both WW1 & WW2 by having some form of ceremony on the 11th November each year. Let's change that from a ceremony into a Bank Holiday on the 1st or 2nd Monday of November as a perpetual reminder.

attributes.action: Help for separated parents to get back on the property ladder
attributes.background: Especially when the 'other half' is legally entitled to the existing property (if children are involved) and the person who has to leave, finds it difficult to start again and fund a new purchase (especially when older, 40+) with deposit, stamp duty and a limited mortgage term due to age.

attributes.action: Food tolerance testing on the NHS
attributes.background: Ive lived for years with severe IBS in and out of hospital,  test after test with no light at the end of the tunel to why im in pain 24hours a day 7 days a week.
attributes.additional_details: Ive lived for years with severe IBS in and out of hospital,  test after test with no light at the end of the tunel to why im in pain 24hours a day 7 days a week. This is costing the NHS millions every year treating people with drugs and tests when it can all be done with a simple food tolerance test that the NHS do not supply.  sign this petition to get this service put on the NHS to help 1000 of people each year lead a pain free life.

attributes.action: Call for legal representation for all children detained by the police at school
attributes.background: Currently innocent children unaware of their legal rights can be secretly detained and questioned by the police and social workers at their school without parents. Any questioning by the police should be done at a police station in the presence of a legal representative for the child, not at school.
attributes.additional_details: Call for the government to debate that schools should be a place of learning not for children to be detained and questioned. The relationship between children, parents and the school should only relate to education and schools should be a place of opportunity for children to develop their personality and talents and prepare for responsibility in life. Schools should be neutral and not police detention centres.  The Rights of children must be protected at school and not to have their rights abused

attributes.action: Abolish the use of whole life sentences in England and Wales
attributes.background: Whole life sentences mean that a prisoner is effectively condemned to stay in prison until they die. There are about 8,000 prisoners serving life sentences in England and Wales, and at least 60 of those are serving whole life sentences.
attributes.additional_details: Nobody can predict when a prisoner will die, and in many cases they will reach an age where they will be no threat to society. And it has been proven in the past that even some of the worst criminals can rehabilitate and therefore qualify for parole. And what incentive do they have to behave in prison if they have no realistic hope of parole? Several such prisoners have behaved very violently in prison,  injuring other inmates, and one even committed further killings in prison.

attributes.action: National Volunteer Service. (NVS)
attributes.background: In the old days we had a national service where two years were spent training and preparing for war as apart of our public service, instead of destroying the world with our hands, we can build and heal the world by volunteering at home or abroad.
attributes.additional_details:
The idea is to get youth involved in aid, charity, sustainable development and homelessness programmes. A mandatory year is spent in volunteering after compulsory education. This would be an excellent opportunity for youth to gain work experience, a work ethic, employment opportunities, to character build and have fun.

This was inspired through the work undertaken by being a volunteer in the Raleigh ICS programme.

attributes.action: Make arrangements due to the EU Referendum clashing with Glastonbury festival.
attributes.background:
The date for the EU Referendum is on the 23rd June. This date falls within Glastonbury Festival.

Holding the vote on the same day as around 150,000 will be otherwise occupied is a disgrace to democracy.
attributes.additional_details:
I propose that either special arrangements are made so the attendees can vote or the vote is moved.

Making sure people are aware of the upcoming vote and ensuring the postal voting system can cope with the influx of votes would be a prudent move.

Additionally, work with the organisers of the festival to communicate with attendees the importance of the vote and communicate how to register to vote via post.

attributes.action: Allow Councils to decide the amount of Hunting they want to allow.
attributes.background: The Hunting Act of 2004 and the Protection of Wild Mammals Act (Scotland) of 2002, ban the Hunting of wild mammals with dogs. There are arguments for and against this bill, but there is a large amount of people who want it repealed and a large amount of people who want it strengthened.
attributes.additional_details: Why not allow local councils to vote whether to keep the ban as it, weaken it slightly, strengthen it, or outright repeal it, this would be a way for local democracy in this country to help those who feel passionately on both sides. This could allow councils in rural areas that are against the ban, to show this and would allow councils in areas where people are passionately for the ban to strengthen the ban to levels they find acceptable?

attributes.action: Urgently Review current legislation on Oil&Gas developments near major Airports.
attributes.background:
With the news out recently regarding Horse Hill and the flow testing of their well of which has produced flows of conventional oil, it's apparent that the legislation needs to be reviewed urgently.
This well is just over a mile from Gatwick airport and clearly this is a concern if it was developed.
attributes.additional_details: Listed companies that are investors in HorseHill developments Ltd the licence holder of the well, have recently realised RNS's confirming flow rates of Oil and clearly this projects is likely to be developed over time and the current laws and regs do not reflect this advancement and their are concerns regarding safety considering this well and any future (possibly hundreds) wells are within a very short distance from a major airport (gatwick) oil storage tanks and airplanes don't mix.

attributes.action: Ban publicly accountable bodies from buying through 'middlemen' companies.
attributes.background: public sector buying organisations should not be able to outsource to larger private companies/buying platforms when dealing with small business. This only enriches the middlemen, prevents barriers to small business and will not produce public savings or improve quality of services.
attributes.additional_details: The North East Procurement Organisation (NEPO) representing twelve local authorities and others such as Sanctuary Housing group has appointed a single private company called NEPRO which small business must trade through. This outsources responsibility to a private company, prices will rise to pay the middlemen, public money will not be saved. It is another barrier to small business trading with government. It is also bad practice as the middlemen can control trade and who gets opportunities.

attributes.action: Rethink the way in which employment and support allowance is examined
attributes.background: Employment support allowance medical assessments are only done once at 14 weeks - things can change medically so they need doing more than once - they are also not robust enough
attributes.additional_details: I have several disabilities and illnesses myself and have been placed in the work category yet I am unable to hold down a job

attributes.action: Create a law that babies born prison should live with other relatives
attributes.background: Babies who are born in prison can't help it and should be moved to other relatives or adopted.
attributes.additional_details: Actually what inspired me may sound really cheesy, but it was Aerosmith's cover of Give Peace A Chance, with Sierra Leone's all-star refugees saying we shouldn't punish the kids for what they never did. Just like whether someone is black, or white, or Asian or whatever, they can't help it. And neither are kids who are born in prisons. Adults who go to prison KNOW why they're there and it's because they've done wrong (90% of the time), so I'm calling on David Cameron to create a law which means babies born in UK prisons are immediately taken out to live with other relatives in a stable loving home, or if needs be, adopted/fostered.

attributes.action: Limit council tax exemption to students housed in purpose built accommodation.
attributes.background: When Coventry planning committee agree another student accommodation development they quote that this will return a good number of current "student houses" back to use as family homes. To encourage this only students in purpose built multiple occupation properties should be exempt from council tax.

attributes.action: Make competition in the water industry as we currently have for gas and electric
attributes.background: Competition in the gas and electricity market has been in force for over 15 years however the water industry remains an uncompetitive market whereby a consumer has no choice over who supplies their clean water and who deals with waste water.
attributes.additional_details: Gas and electricity is an open market allowing a consumer to switch supplier for cheaper rates relatively easy. No such thing is available for clean and waste water. Consumers are stuck with the supplier for their region and cannot influence the price they pay.

attributes.action: NHS doctors should not be allowed to charge fees for care home visits
attributes.background: NHS doctors should not be allowed charge extra fees for care home visits.Currently some practices are charging care homes circa £100,00 per year as a retainer.The elderly have, generally, paid into the national health service all of their lives and now in their old age are being penalised.

attributes.action: Plase let Second generations born outside the UK have British Citizenship.
attributes.background: Britain only lets first generations born outside the UK have citizenship. At least one more generation should be elegible like in other countries.
attributes.additional_details: Let a second generation be born outside the UK like when act 1981 was made for first generations by descent.
